commit message: Fix weechat-relay README

Update build configuration

Updating build to support copying files to the gh-pages branch
Created a dist target for making a release
Fixed a warning about project name in the custom_rules.xml file
Delete eclipse project configurations
Don't count filtered lines as unread

Cleanup

Added some setup details to the readme
Include the slf4j-simple jar file when building the example
Changed the example default server to localhost

Add more tests for protocol/Data

A few more tests, and some fixes to go along with them.

Fix issue with unprintable characters in title

In the bufferlist, colors/other unprintable characters show as boxes.
Strip colors from the title, and modified stripColors to also strip
unprintable characters. This appears to fix the issue. Thanks R1cochet
for the bug report.

Strip color in buffer title properly

Colors in a buffer title are not converted to weechat's internal color
scheme, so we need to strip IRC style colors from them.

Added method stripIRCColors to Color to suppor this.
Modified BufferListAdapter to call that method to clean the title for
display.
Update build.xml for continuous integration
Add java keystore for signing the app

Update readme with devel snapshot information

This project is now built by clouldbees after every commit to provide
better access for the end users. Official releases will still be posted
on github.
Make password preference text editor hide password

Add preference for prefix alignment

Prefix alignment defaults to right, but can be changed to left align.
Updated the ChatView Activity to load preference changes as soon as they
are made.
Small tweak to the Readme

Performance WIP

Replacing TableView with a ListView for performance.  Mostly working
right here.  Minor fixes/improvements to follow.

Cleanup

Remove unused class LRUMap.
Remove unused variable in BufferListAdapter.

Visual/Preference Tweaks

Added preference for alignment(left, right, or none)
Added some padding between timestamps/prefixes/messages

Hide keyboard when launching chat window

The onscreen keyboard is now hidden when the chatviewactivity is
launched, instead of popping up in your face when you open a chat.

Also, touching a 'listitem' no longer highlights it quite so obviously.

Add filtering of lines back in

Lines can now be filtered the same as if they were in weechat.

Add values.xml for preference usage

Two arrays to start with, for the prefix_alignment setting we have now.

Make more user friendly

Increase spacing between prefix and message
Add placeholder while messages are loading

Fix filtering of lines

When the dataset changes, go through and remove lines that should be
filtered, rather than drawing an empty line item.  This makes the
display a lot nicer(no hidden list items)

Modify build to include version information

Added about dialog to the app
Embed the contents of 'git describe' into the app.

Move version footer to title

Eliminate footer in the buffer list, no reason to take up space when we
can just set it in the title.

Eliminate error messages from BufferManager

Due to the split nature of the if/else statements, buffermanager was
always complaining about 'unknown id listbuffers'.  Fixed.

Add quick toggles back for timestamps/filters

Add toggles to the menu when in a chatview for toggling the
timestamps/filters without changing the setting. Fixes #5
Tweak about screen

Make links clickable in chat messages

Fixes #6
Bump version for v0.06 release
Add screenshot/fix typo for release
